name: Seasons Greetings
description: This was our second group project during the UW Coding Bootcamp. We were instructed to create a full stack website that accomplished a task. Our website, Season Greetings, is a simple website that helps users find fresh product that is currently in season in their state, and then offers different recipes that the user can look at to make a special meal.
description2: We created our own data for the produce, and then MealDB as an API for accessing the recipes. Our stack was Node.js back-end, JavaScript front-end, and MySQL for the database. We used Handlebars.js to manipulate the HTML, a stepping stone into learning REACT
tech: HTML | CSS | JavaScript | Node.js | Bcrypt | Express.js | MySQL | Handlebars | Passport | Sequelize.js | Socket.io |

name: Worth A Shot
description: This was our first group project during the UW Coding Bootcamp. We were only intructed to create a front-end website that accomplished a task. Worth a Shot makes it easy for a user to find a fun drink to make when they have run short of ideas. Just select a hard alcohol with a chaser, and we will give you recipes along with a video tutorial.
description2: We used MealDB for the recipes, along with the Youtube API to access video tutorials. As this was our first project, we only used HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to create an interactive front-end.

name: Note Taker
description: A simple application that let a user record and save notes; our task for this assigement was to create and operate the API

name: Workout Tracker
description: An application that tracked a users workouts stats and exercise; our assignment was to set up the DB with mongoose
tech: HTML | CSS | JavaScript | Node.js | MongoDB | Mongoose | Express.js |

name: Tech Blog
description: A blog that a user can log in, create posts, and explore/comment on other users posts; coded from scratch
tech: HTML | CSS | JavaScript | Node.js | Bcrypt | Compression | Express.js | MySQL | Sequelize |

name: Weather App
description: A front-end weather app. This homework assignment was API calling practice, in which we used the Open Weather Map API to get Tempature, Humidity, Wind Speed, and Icons for a searched location.
description2: We were also able to get this data for a 5-day forecast, which I displayed below todays weather. The disign of this webpage is very basic, as the main goal was to make sure the API calls worked accuretely.
